sentences.chinese: 他们过去放羊的田野

detailed_translations.english: if an animal grazes, or if you graze it, it eats grass that is growing
to accidentally break the surface of your skin by rubbing it against something
a wound caused by rubbing that slightly breaks the surface of your skin

name: grinding
trans: adj. 刺耳的；磨的；令人难以忍受的

name: gross
trans: adj. 总共的；粗野的；恶劣的；显而易见的; vt. 总共收入; n. 总额，总数 比较级: grosser, grossest 名 词: grosser 副 词:...

sentences.english: He abused the Admiral in the grossest terms.
sentences.chinese: 他用最粗俗的字眼辱骂那位海军上将。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone's speech or behaviour is gross, you think it is very coarse, vulgar, or unacceptable

name: guarantee
trans: vt. 保证；担保; 使可能发生; n. 保证，保障；保证书；保用期; 担保，担保人; 担保品，抵押品 时 态: guaranteed，guaranteeing，guarantees

sentences.english: The bank will only lend me money if my parents guarantee the loan.
sentences.chinese: 只有我父母作担保，银行才会给我贷款。

sentences.english: I’m afraid there’s no guarantee of success.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕不能保证一定会成功。

detailed_translations.english: to promise that you will pay back money that someone else has borrowed, if they do not pay it back themselves
a formal promise that something will be done

name: guideline
trans: n. 指导方针, 准则

sentences.english: This chapter gives you some guidelines to help you in your work.
sentences.chinese: 本章将介绍一些指导性原则，为你的工作提供帮助。

detailed_translations.english: rules or instructions about the best way to do something

name: habitat
trans: n. 栖息地, 住处

sentences.english: watching monkeys in their natural habitat
sentences.chinese: 观察自然生活环境中的猴子

sentences.english: The grassland is an important habitat for many wild flowers.
sentences.chinese: 这片草原是很多野花的重要生长地。

detailed_translations.english: the natural home of a plant or animal

name: halt
trans: vi. 停止；踌躇，犹豫；立定; n. 停止；立定；休息; vt. 使停止；使立定 时 态: halted, halting, halts

sentences.english: Heavy snowfalls brought traffic to a halt (= made it stop moving ).
sentences.chinese: 大雪使得交通陷于停顿。

sentences.english: The World Championship was brought to a temporary halt (= was stopped from continuing ).
sentences.chinese: 世界锦标赛暂停举行。

sentences.english: The President has called for a halt to the wave of emigration.
sentences.chinese: 总统呼吁遏制移民国外的热潮。

detailed_translations.english: a stop or pause
to prevent someone or something from continuing - used especially in news reports

name: harsh
trans: adj. 粗糙的；刺耳的；严厉的；严酷的；刺目的 比较级: harsher, harshest 副 词: harshly 名 词: harshness

sentences.english: The hostages are being held in harsh conditions.
sentences.chinese: 人质被拘押在恶劣环境中。

sentences.english: a young girl suddenly exposed to the harsh realities of life
sentences.chinese: 骤然暴露于残酷现实生活中的小女孩

detailed_translations.english: harsh conditions are difficult to live in and very uncomfortable

name: hatch
trans: n. 舱口；孵化; vt. 策划；孵; vi. 孵化 时 态: hatched, hatching, hatches 名 词: hatcher

sentences.english: The problems do not end if crocodiles successfully hatch from the eggs.
sentences.chinese: 即使鳄鱼成功地从卵中孵化出来，这些问题也不会终止。

detailed_translations.english: a hole in a ship or aircraft, usually used for loading goods, or the door that covers it
if an egg hatches, or if it is hatched, it breaks, letting the young bird, insect etc come out

name: herb
trans: n. 香草，药草 形容词: herby

sentences.english: Sprinkle the dish with chopped fresh herbs.
sentences.chinese: 在菜肴上撒些切碎的新鲜香草。

detailed_translations.english: a small plant that is used to improve the taste of food, or to make medicine

name: heritage
trans: n. 遗产, 继承物; 传统

sentences.english: the importance of preserving the national heritage
sentences.chinese: 保护民族遗产的重要性

sentences.english: beautiful old buildings which are part of our heritage
sentences.chinese: 属于我们遗产一部分的漂亮古建筑

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗产；传统；继承物；继承权
detailed_translations.english: the traditional beliefs, values, customs etc of a family, country, or society

name: highlight
trans: vt. 强调, 突出, 使显著; n. 最精彩的部分, 最重要的事情 时 态: highlighted, highlighting, highlights

sentences.english: Your résumé should highlight your skills and achievements.
sentences.chinese: 你的简历应该突出自己的技能和成绩。

sentences.english: That weekend in Venice was definitely the highlight of our trip.
sentences.chinese: 在威尼斯度过的那个周末无疑是我们这次旅行最精彩的部分。

detailed_translations.english: to make a problem or subject easy to notice so that people pay attention to it
the most important, interesting, or enjoyable part of something such as a holiday, performance, or sports competition

name: hollow
trans: adj. 空的；凹的；虚伪的；中空的，空腹的; n. 洞；山谷；窟窿; vt. 使成为空洞; vi. 形成空洞; adv. 无用地；彻底地 比较级: hollower, hollo...

sentences.english: a hollow tree
sentences.chinese: 空心树

sentences.english: Any threat to bring in the police is a hollow one.
sentences.chinese: 任何要叫警察来的威胁都是虚张声势。

sentences.english: The steps were hollowed by centuries of use.
sentences.chinese: 经过几个世纪的踩踏，台阶上出现了凹痕

detailed_translations.chinese: 空的,中空的;；空洞的,无价值的
detailed_translations.english: having an empty space inside
to make the surface of something curve inwards

name: horizontal
trans: adj. 水平的, 与地平线平行的副 词: horizontally

sentences.english: a horizontal surface
sentences.chinese: 水平面

detailed_translations.chinese: 水平的；地平线的；同一阶层的
detailed_translations.english: flat and level

detailed_translations.chinese: 水平线，水平面；水平位置
detailed_translations.english: a horizontal line or surface

name: hut
trans: n. 小屋；临时营房; vt. 使住在小屋中；驻扎; vi. 住在小屋中；驻扎 时 态: hutted, hutting, huts

sentences.english: a wooden hut
sentences.chinese: 小木屋

detailed_translations.english: a small simple building with only one or two rooms

name: identical
trans: adj. 同一的副 词: identically

sentences.english: four identical houses
sentences.chinese: 四幢一模一样的房子

detailed_translations.english: exactly the same, or very similar

name: ignore
trans: vt. 驳回诉讼，忽视，不理睬 时 态: ignored, ignoring, ignores

sentences.english: The phone rang, but she ignored it.
sentences.chinese: 电话铃响了，但她只当没听见。

sentences.english: Sam rudely ignored the question.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆粗鲁地对这个问题不予理睬。

detailed_translations.english: to behave as if you had not heard or seen someone or something

name: illegal
trans: adj. 非法的；违法的；违反规则的; n. 非法移民；间谍 副 词: illegally

sentences.english: illegal drugs
sentences.chinese: 违禁药品

sentences.english: They were involved in illegal activities.
sentences.chinese: 他们参与了非法活动。

detailed_translations.english: not allowed by the law

name: illiterate
trans: adj. 目不识丁的,文盲的; n. 目不识丁者,文盲; n. 文盲,无知 名 词: illiterate

sentences.english: It was an illiterate letter, full of mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 这封信文笔拙劣，错误连篇。

detailed_translations.chinese: 文盲的；不识字的；没受教育的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is illiterate has not learned to read or write
someone who has not learned to read or write

name: illustration
trans: n. 插图, 图表, 图案; 例证, 实例; 说明, 图解, 图示 形容词: illustrational

sentences.english: The book contains 62 pages of illustrations.
sentences.chinese: 这本书有62页插图。

detailed_translations.english: a picture in a book, article etc, especially one that helps you to understand it

name: imbalance
trans: n. 不平衡,不均衡,失调

sentences.english: a hormonal imbalance
sentences.chinese: 内分泌失调

detailed_translations.english: a lack of a fair or correct balance between two things, which results in problems or unfairness

name: implicit
trans: adj. 暗示的；盲从的；含蓄的 副 词: implicitly

sentences.english: ...an implicit warning to the Moroccans not to continue or repeat the military actions they began a week ago.
sentences.chinese: …叫摩洛哥人不要继续或重复一周前开始的军事行动的含蓄警告。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不言明的， 含蓄的； 内含的， 固有的； 无疑问的
detailed_translations.english: suggested or understood without being stated directly

name: impose
trans: vi. 欺骗；利用；施加影响; vt. 强加；以…欺骗；征税 时 态: imposed, imposing, imposes 名 词: imposer

sentences.english: Parents should beware of imposing their own tastes on their children.
sentences.chinese: 父母应该提防把自己的兴趣强加给孩子。

sentences.english: A new tax was imposed on fuel.
sentences.chinese: 当局开始对燃油征收一项新税。

detailed_translations.english: If you impose your opinions or beliefs on other people, you try and make people accept them as a rule or as a model to copy

name: incentive
trans: n. 激励某人做某事的事物；刺激；诱因，动机

sentences.english: As an added incentive, there’s a bottle of champagne for the best team.
sentences.chinese: 给最优秀的队发一瓶香槟作为额外的鼓励。

detailed_translations.english: something that encourages you to work harder, start a new activity etc

name: incidence
trans: n. 发生率, 影响范围

sentences.english: an area with a high incidence of crime
sentences.chinese: 犯罪率高的地区

sentences.english: the angle of incidence
sentences.chinese: 入射角

detailed_translations.english: the extent to which sth happens or has an effect

name: incorporate
trans: vt. 包含, 加上, 吸收; 把…合并, 使并入; 组成公司 时 态: incorporated, incorporating, incorporates 形容词: inc...

sentences.english: It allows you to harness existing technologies and incorporate them into one application.
sentences.chinese: 它允许您利用现有的技术并将它们合并到同一个应用程序中。

sentences.english: The next step is to generate the report and then incorporate it as an affiliated document of the master document.
sentences.chinese: 紧接着的步骤就是产生这个报告，然后将它作为主文档的附属文档与主文档合并。

name: indication
trans: n. 指示, 表示; 象征, 迹象

sentences.english: Could you give me some indication as to when I am likely to receive a reply?
sentences.chinese: 你能给我透露一下什么时候我能收到回复吗？

sentences.english: Indications are that the situation hasn’t improved much.
sentences.chinese: 迹象表明局势并没有多大好转。

sentences.english: There is every indication (= there are very clear signs ) that it is true.
sentences.chinese: 很明显这是真的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 指示， 表示， 表明； 象征， 迹象
detailed_translations.english: a sign, remark, event etc that shows what is happening, what someone is thinking or feeling, or what is true

name: indigenous
trans: adj. 土生土长的; 生来的, 固有的 副 词: indigenously 名 词: indigenousness

sentences.english: the many indigenous cultures which existed in Siberia
sentences.chinese: 存在于西伯利亚的许多当地文化

detailed_translations.chinese: 本土的；土著的；国产的；固有的
detailed_translations.english: indigenous people or things have always been in the place where they are, rather than being brought there from somewhere else

name: induce
trans: vt. 引诱；感应；诱导；引起 时 态: induced, inducing, induces 形容词: inducible

sentences.english: Nothing would induce me to vote for him again.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么能诱使我再投他的票了。

sentences.english: Doctors said surgery could induce a heart attack.
sentences.chinese: 医生们说手术可能导致心脏病。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something, especially something that does not seem wise

name: industrialise
trans: vt. & vi. 工业化

sentences.english: The way to bring cost down is to industrialise much of the process.
sentences.chinese: 降低成本的方法是将这个过程的大部分工业化。

sentences.english: It took the west 300 years to industrialise and build a mature society with strong institutions. And even now serious inequalities and social tension remain.
sentences.chinese: 西方花了300年来完成工业化，建立起强大制度构建的成熟社会，而甚至到现在严峻的不平等和社会紧张依然存在。

name: infection
trans: n. 〈医〉传染, 感染; 传染病

sentences.english: The baby had an ear infection.
sentences.chinese: 宝宝耳朵感染了。

detailed_translations.english: a disease that affects a particular part of your body and is caused by bacteria or a virus

name: infrastructure
trans: n. 基础设施; 基础结构

sentences.english: Some countries lack a suitable economic infrastructure.
sentences.chinese: 一些国家缺乏适当的经济基础设施。

sentences.english: a $65 billion investment package in education, health care and infrastructure
sentences.chinese: 用于教育、医疗和基础设施的650亿美元一揽子投资计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 基础设施；公共建设；下部构造
detailed_translations.english: the basic systems and structures that a country or organization needs in order to work properly, for example roads, railways, banks etc

name: ingredient
trans: n. 组成部分; 配料

sentences.english: Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl.
sentences.chinese: 把所有食材都放在一个大碗里。

sentences.english: The food is home-cooked using fresh ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 这种食物是用新鲜的食材在家里烹制的。

detailed_translations.english: one of the foods that you use to make a particular food or dish

name: initiate
trans: vt. 开始，创始；发起；使初步了解; n. 开始；新加入者，接受初步知识者; adj. 新加入的；接受初步知识的 时 态: initiated, initiating, init...

sentences.english: They have decided to initiate legal proceedings against the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定向该报提起法律诉讼。

sentences.english: Intellectuals have initiated a debate on terrorism.
sentences.chinese: 知识分子就恐怖主义发起了辩论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开始， 创造， 发起； 使初步了解； 接纳， 让…加入
detailed_translations.english: to arrange for something important to start, such as an official process or a new plan
someone who has been allowed to join a particular organization, club, or group and has been taught its secrets

name: innovative
trans: adj. 新发明的，新引进的；革新的；有改革精神的; 乐于引进新观念的

sentences.english: an innovative approach to language teaching
sentences.chinese: 创新的语言教学法

sentences.english: innovative schemes for recycling waste materials
sentences.chinese: 废物回收利用的创新计划

detailed_translations.english: an innovative idea or way of doing something is new, different, and better than those that existed before

name: insight
trans: n. 洞察力, 洞悉, 深刻的见解; 领悟, 顿悟

sentences.english: a writer of great insight
sentences.chinese: 有深刻洞察力的作家

sentences.english: The book gives us fascinating insights into life in Mexico.
sentences.chinese: 这本书生动地表现了墨西哥的生活。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand and realize what people or situations are really like

name: insist
trans: vt. 坚持，强调; vi. 坚持，强调 时 态: insisted, insisting, insists

sentences.english: Stay for supper – I insist!
sentences.chinese: 留下来吃晚餐——一定的！

detailed_translations.english: to demand that something should happen

name: install
trans: vt. 安装; 安顿, 安置; 使…正式就职 时 态: installed, installing, installs also instals 名 词: installer

sentences.english: They’ve installed the new computer network at last.
sentences.chinese: 他们终于安装了新电脑网络。

sentences.english: Security cameras have been installed in the city centre.
sentences.chinese: 在市中心已安装了一些监控摄像机。

detailed_translations.english: to put a piece of equipment somewhere and connect it so that it is ready to be used

name: instantly
trans: adv. 立刻，立即；马上

sentences.english: All four victims died instantly.
sentences.chinese: 四名受害人全部当即死亡。

sentences.english: The information was instantly available.
sentences.chinese: 信息即时可得。

detailed_translations.english: immediately

name: institute
trans: vt. 建立，制定；开始，着手; n. 协会，学会；学院，研究院 时 态: instituted，instituting，institutes

sentences.english: We will institute a number of measures to better safeguard the public.
sentences.chinese: 我们将制定许多措施更好地保护公众。

sentences.english: research institutes
sentences.chinese: 研究所

detailed_translations.english: If you institute a system, rule, or course of action, you start it

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔从事科研或教育等的〕机构；学院；研究院
detailed_translations.english: an organization that has a particular purpose such as scientific or educational work, or the building where this organization is based

name: insufficient
trans: adj. 不足的,不够的副 词: insufficiently

sentences.english: Insufficient resources have been devoted to the health service.
sentences.chinese: 用于医疗保健服务的资源不足。

detailed_translations.english: not enough, or not great enough

name: insurance
trans: n. 保险; 保险业; 保险费; 保险措施, 安全保障

sentences.english: Your father took out insurance to cover the mortgage.
sentences.chinese: 你父亲购买了抵押借款保险。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement with a company in which you pay them money, especially regularly, and they pay the costs if something bad happens, for example if you become ill or your car is damaged

name: integrate
trans: vt. 使结合成为整体; vt. & vi. 融入 时 态: integrated, integrating, integrates 形容词: integrative

sentences.english: These programs can be integrated with your existing software.
sentences.chinese: 这些程序能和你的已有的软件整合成一体。

detailed_translations.english: to combine two or more things so that they work together; to combine with sth else in this way

name: intelligent
trans: adj. 聪明的; 理解力强的形容词: intelligential 副 词: intelligently

sentences.english: a group of highly intelligent (= very intelligent )students
sentences.chinese: 一组聪明异常的学生

sentences.english: Sontag was once famously described as the most intelligent woman in America.
sentences.chinese: 桑塔格曾被称为美国最聪明的女人，这是众人皆知的事。

detailed_translations.english: an intelligent person has a high level of mental ability and is good at understanding ideas and thinking clearly

name: intense
trans: adj. 强烈的；紧张的；热情的；非常的 比较级: intenser, intensest 副 词: intensely

sentences.english: Young people today are under intense pressure to succeed.
sentences.chinese: 如今的年轻人面临要出人头地的巨大压力。

sentences.english: the intense heat of the desert
sentences.chinese: 沙漠的炽热

sentences.english: The pain was so intense I couldn’t sleep.
sentences.chinese: 疼得我都睡不着觉。

sentences.english: He took an intense interest in all religious matters.
sentences.chinese: 他对所有宗教事宜都很感兴趣。

sentences.english: a look of intense dislike
sentences.chinese: 极端厌恶的表情

sentences.english: The job demands intense concentration.
sentences.chinese: 这工作需要全神贯注。

detailed_translations.english: having a very strong effect or felt very strongly

name: interact
trans: vi. 相互作用, 互相配合时 态: interacted, interacting, interacts

sentences.english: While the other children interacted and played together, Ted ignored them.
sentences.chinese: 当其他孩子们相互交往、一起玩耍时，泰德却不理他们。

detailed_translations.english: if people interact with each other, they talk to each other, work together etc

name: interior
trans: n. 内部; 内地; adj. 内部的; 内地的, 国内的 名 词: interiority 副 词: interiorly

sentences.english: The interior walls are all painted white.
sentences.chinese: 室内墙壁都粉刷成了白色。

sentences.english: The interior of the church was dark.
sentences.chinese: 教堂里很暗。

detailed_translations.english: inside or indoors
the inner part or inside of something

name: internal
trans: adj. 国内的；内部的；内在的 名 词: internality 副 词: internally

sentences.english: We have no interest in interfering in the internal affairs of other countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们对干涉其他国家内政不感兴趣。

sentences.english: the threat to internal security
sentences.chinese: 对国内安全的威胁

sentences.english: internal markets
sentences.chinese: 国内市场

sentences.english: There’s to be an internal inquiry into the whole affair.
sentences.chinese: 对整个事件将进行内部调查。

detailed_translations.english: within a particular country

name: interval
trans: n. 间隔；幕间休息；间距

sentences.english: He left the room, returning after a short interval with a message.
sentences.chinese: 他离开房间，过了一会儿就带回来一条消息。

sentences.english: We can get some drinks in the interval.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以在幕间休息时喝点什么。

sentences.english: Trees had been planted at regular intervals.
sentences.chinese: 树已按均距栽种。

detailed_translations.english: the period of time between two events, activities etc

name: joint
trans: n. 关节；接合处，接合点；接缝；大块肉; adj. 联合的，合办的；共同的；连接的; vt. 连接，贴合；接合；使有接头; vi. 贴合；生节 时 态: jointed, joi...

sentences.english: The two ministers have issued a joint statement.
sentences.chinese: 两位部长发布了一项联合声明。

sentences.english: Both companies are involved in the joint development of a new medium-sized car.
sentences.chinese: 两家公司联合开发一款新的中型汽车。

sentences.english: The meal was a joint effort(= two or more people worked on it together ).
sentences.chinese: 这顿饭是大家一起做的。

sentences.english: Manchester United and Arsenal are joint favourites to win the title (= are thought to have the same chance of winning ).
sentences.chinese: 曼联和阿森纳均为夺冠的热门球队。

sentences.english: Both parties must sign the form if the account is to be in joint names(= belong to two named people ).
sentences.chinese: 如果这是联名账户的话，双方都必须在表格上签名。

detailed_translations.english: involving two or more people or groups, or owned or shared by them
a part of your body that can bend because two bones meet there

name: judgement
trans: n. 审判，判决；裁判; 判断，判断力; 看法，意见，评价

sentences.english: He trusted in his judgement.
sentences.chinese: 他相信他的判断。

sentences.english: All action is based on judgement.
sentences.chinese: 一切行动均以判断为基础。

sentences.english: The judgement is often biased by interest.
sentences.chinese: 判断往往因利害关系而有偏差。

name: junction
trans: n. 连接，接合；交叉点；接合点

sentences.english: the junction of Abbot Road and Mill Street
sentences.chinese: 阿伯特路与米尔街的交叉口

sentences.english: Junction 5 on the M40
sentences.chinese: 40号高速公路上的第5交叉口

detailed_translations.english: a place where one road, track etc joins another

name: juvenile
trans: adj. 青少年的；幼稚的; n. 青少年；少年读物

sentences.english: juvenile crime
sentences.chinese: 少年犯罪

sentences.english: a juvenile court
sentences.chinese: 少年法院[法庭]

sentences.english: The number of juveniles in the general population has fallen by a fifth in the past 10 years.
sentences.chinese: 在过去的10年中，青少年在总人口中所占的比重下降了1/5。

detailed_translations.chinese: 少年的，少年特有的；幼稚的，不成熟的
detailed_translations.english: law relating to young people who are not yet adults
A juvenile is a child or young person who is not yet old enough to be regarded as an adult

name: keen
trans: adj. 锋利的; 热衷的，热心的，渴望; 激烈的，紧张的; 良好的；敏锐的，敏捷的 比较级: keener，keenest 副 词: keenly 名 词: kee...

sentences.english: keen students
sentences.chinese: 求知若渴的学生

sentences.english: The kids in my class are all very keen.
sentences.chinese: 我班上的学生都很好学。

sentences.english: She was new in the job and keen as mustard (= very keen ).
sentences.chinese: 她刚开始做这工作，热情很高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热心的； 激烈的； 敏锐的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is keen is eager to work or learn, and enjoys doing it

name: label
trans: vt. 标注；贴标签于; n. 标签；商标；签条 时 态: labeled , labelled labeling , labelling labels , labels

sentences.english: a luggage label
sentences.chinese: 行李标签

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper or another material that is attached to something and gives information about it
to attach a label onto something or write information on something

name: landmark
trans: n. 陆标，地标；里程碑；地界标；划时代的事

name: landscape
trans: n. 风景, 景色; 风景画, 风景照 时 态: landscaped, landscaping, landscapes 名 词: landscaper

sentences.english: the beauty of the New England landscape
sentences.chinese: 新英格兰风光之美

detailed_translations.english: an area of countryside or land of a particular type, used especially when talking about its appearance
to make a park, garden etc look attractive and interesting by changing its design, and by planting trees and bushes etc

name: launch
trans: vt. 发射；发起，发动；使…下水; vi. 下水；开始；起飞; n. 发射；下水；汽艇；发行，投放市场 时 态: launched, launching, launches

sentences.english: A test satellite was launched from Cape Canaveral.
sentences.chinese: 一颗实验人造卫星从卡纳维拉尔角发射升空。

sentences.english: The organization has launched a campaign to raise $150,000.
sentences.chinese: 为了筹集15万美元，该组织发起了一场募捐活动。

sentences.english: The Canadian police plan to launch an investigation into the deal.
sentences.chinese: 加拿大警方计划对这宗交易进行调查。

sentences.english: The book launched his career as a novelist.
sentences.chinese: 这本书开启了他的小说创作生涯。

detailed_translations.english: to send a weapon or spacecraft into the sky or into space

name: layer
trans: n. 层，阶层；地层; vt. 用压条法培植；把...堆积成层; vi. 借助压条法生根繁殖 时 态: layered, layering, layers

sentences.english: He pulled off layer upon layer of clothing (= many layers of clothing ).
sentences.chinese: 他把衣服一件件地脱掉。

detailed_translations.english: an amount or piece of a material or substance that covers a surface or that is between two other things

name: layout
trans: n. 布局；设计；安排；陈列

sentences.english: All the flats in the building had the same layout.
sentences.chinese: 大楼里所有的公寓布局都是一样的。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which something such as a town, garden, or building is arranged

name: leaflet
trans: n. 传单, 散页印刷品时 态: leafleted also leafletted leafleting leafletting leaflets leaflets

sentences.english: a leaflet on skin cancer
sentences.chinese: 有关皮肤癌的宣传页

sentences.english: Students were handing out election leaflets at the station.
sentences.chinese: 学生在车站分发选举传单。

detailed_translations.english: a small book or piece of paper advertising something or giving information on a particular subject

name: liquid
trans: n. 液体; adj. 液体的, 液态的; 清澈的, 明亮的; 流畅的; 易转换成现款的, 流动的 副 词: liquidly 名 词: liquidness

sentences.english: Add a little more liquid to the sauce.
sentences.chinese: 在酱汁中再加一点水。

sentences.english: Children take antibiotics in liquid form.
sentences.chinese: 儿童服用液态抗生素。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is not a solid or a gas, for example water or milk
in the form of a liquid instead of a gas or solid

name: load
trans: n. 负载，负荷；装载量；工作量; vi. 装货；装载；加载; vt. 使担负；装填 时 态: loaded, loading, loads

sentences.english: Have you finished loading up?
sentences.chinese: 你装完货了吗？

sentences.english: It took an hour to load the van.
sentences.chinese: 给小型货车装货花了一小时。

sentences.english: Will you help me load the dishwasher?
sentences.chinese: 你帮我把碗碟放进洗碗机好吗？

sentences.english: The plane was carrying afull loadof fuel.
sentences.chinese: 飞机载满燃料。

detailed_translations.english: to put a large quantity of something into a vehicle or container
a large quantity of something that is carried by a vehicle, person etc

name: maintain
trans: vt. 保持；继续; 保养，维护; 坚持；主张; 供给；赡养 时 态: maintained，maintaining，maintains 名 词: maintainabili...

sentences.english: Careers Officers maintain contact with young people when they have left school.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人离开学校以后，职业指导员和他们保持联系。

sentences.english: Britain wants to maintain its position as a world power.
sentences.chinese: 英国想保持其世界强国的地位。

sentences.english: A lot depends on building and maintaining a good relationship with your customers.
sentences.chinese: 和顾客建立并保持良好关系很重要，很多事情要取决于此。

sentences.english: The hotel prides itself on maintaining high standards.
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店以保持高标准而自豪。

sentences.english: How can we maintain control of spending?
sentences.chinese: 我们如何保持对开支的控制？

sentences.english: Critics maintain that these reforms will lead to a decline in educational standards.
sentences.chinese: 批评者坚称这些改革会导致教育标准下降。

detailed_translations.english: to make something continue in the same way or at the same standard as before

name: marine
trans: adj. 海的，海产的，海生的; 海军的; 海事的，海运的; n. 水兵；海军陆战队士兵

sentences.english: the enormous variety of marine life
sentences.chinese: 海洋生物繁多的种类

sentences.english: the effects of oil pollution on marine mammals
sentences.chinese: 石油污染对海洋哺乳动物的影响

sentences.english: marine biology
sentences.chinese: 海洋生物学

detailed_translations.english: relating to the sea and the creatures that live there

name: master
trans: vt. 控制；精通；征服; n. 主人；大师；硕士；教师; adj. 主要的；主人的；熟练的 时 态: mastered, mastering, masters 名 词: ...

sentences.english: a work of art by a true master
sentences.chinese: 一件真正的大师之作

sentences.english: You’ll have to ask the master’s permission.
sentences.chinese: 你得去请求主人的同意。

sentences.english: You’ll have to ask the master’s permission.
sentences.chinese: 你得去请求主人的同意。

sentences.english: Master of Arts/Science/Education etc
sentences.chinese: 文学/理学/教育学等硕士

detailed_translations.english: someone who is very skilled at something

name: memorise
trans: vt. 记忆；存储

sentences.english: This involved being shown a picture of eight animals and being asked to memorise the order in which the creatures appeared.
sentences.chinese: 其中一项实验是给受试者一张画有八只动物的图片，让他们记住动物的顺序。

sentences.english: In the study, volunteers were given a rubber ball and asked to squeeze it as hard as possible before trying to memorise a list of 72 words.
sentences.chinese: 在这一研究中，研究人员给每个志愿者发了一个橡皮球，并让他们在试着记住一个包含72个单词的列表时尽全力握紧它。

sentences.english: Note - If you need to remember which one to use, memorise this sentence: Why do some people assume they know what other people think about something?
sentences.chinese: 提示：如果你想记住这三个词的区别的话，记住下面这个例句就行了：为什么有些人自认为他们知道别人在想些什么？

name: migrate
trans: vi. 移动；随季节而移居；移往; vt. 使移居；使移植 时 态: migrated, migrating, migrates 名 词: migrator

sentences.english: People migrate to cities like Jakarta in search of work.
sentences.chinese: 人们移居到雅加达这样的城市找工作。

sentences.english: Most birds have to fly long distances to migrate.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的鸟类不得不飞行很长的距离进行迁徙。

detailed_translations.english: if people migrate, they go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

name: millennium
trans: n. 一千年，千年期；千禧年，全人类未来的幸福时代，太平盛世 Millennium白蜜，大白圆粒形容词: millennial 名 词: millennialist

sentences.english: people who have inhabited this land for millennia
sentences.chinese: 在这片土地上已经居住了数千年的人们

detailed_translations.chinese: 千年期，千禧年；一千年，千年纪念；太平盛世，黄金时代
detailed_translations.english: a period of 1,000 years

name: mineral
trans: n. 矿物; 矿石; 矿物质

sentences.english: The area is very rich in minerals .
sentences.chinese: 该地区矿产非常丰富。

sentences.english: a country with few mineral resources
sentences.chinese: 矿产资源稀少的国家

sentences.english: mineral water
sentences.chinese: 矿泉水

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is formed naturally in the earth, such as coal, salt, stone, or gold. Minerals can be dug out of the ground and used
of or containing or derived from minerals

name: minimize
trans: vt. 使减到最少；小看，极度轻视; vi. 最小化 时 态: minimized, minimizing, minimizes 名 词: minimization ...

sentences.english: Every effort is being made to minimize civilian casualties.
sentences.chinese: 正在尽最大努力减少平民伤亡。

sentences.english: The rail company is bringing in more trains in an effort to minimize disruption to travellers.
sentences.chinese: 铁路公司正投入更多的列车来减少旅客的不便。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce something that is difficult, dangerous, or unpleasant to the smallest possible amount or degree

name: modify
trans: vt. 修改，修饰；更改; vi. 修改 时 态: modified, modifying, modifies 名 词: modifiability 形容词: m...

sentences.english: The feedback will be used to modify the course for next year.
sentences.chinese: 这些反馈意见将用于修改明年的课程。

sentences.english: The regulations can only be modified by a special committee.
sentences.chinese: 这些法规只能由特别委员会来修改。

detailed_translations.english: to make small changes to something in order to improve it and make it more suitable or effective

name: module
trans: n. 单元, 单位; 舱

sentences.english: Switch from one module to another.
sentences.chinese: 从一个模块转换到另一个模块。

sentences.english: In this step, you create a new module for the selector.
sentences.chinese: 在此步骤中，您将为选择器创建一个新的模块。

sentences.english: You then iterate the modules that depended on you and remove this module from their lists.
sentences.chinese: 然后迭代具有依赖性的模块，并将这个模块从这些列表中删除。

detailed_translations.english: one of several parts of a piece of computer software that does a particular job

name: monopoly
trans: n. 垄断；垄断者；专卖权 名 词: monopolism 名 词: monopolist 形容词: monopolistic

sentences.english: In the past central government had a monopoly on television broadcasting.
sentences.chinese: 过去，中央政府对电视节目播放实行垄断。

sentences.english: A good education should not be the monopoly of the rich.
sentences.chinese: 良好的教育不应该成为富人的专利。

detailed_translations.english: the complete control of trade in particular goods or the supply of a particular service; a type of goods or a service that is controlled in this way

name: monument
trans: n. 纪念碑；历史遗迹；不朽的作品; vt. 为…树碑

sentences.english: He erected a monument on the spot where his daughter was killed.
sentences.chinese: 他在女儿遇难的地方立了块纪念碑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 纪念碑；历史遗迹；不朽的作品
detailed_translations.english: a building,  statue  , or other large structure that is built to remind people of an important event or famous person

name: moral
trans: adj. 道德的；精神上的；品性端正的; n. 道德；寓意 副 词: morally

sentences.english: It is easy to have an opinion on a moral issue like the death penalty for murder.
sentences.chinese: 对于判谋杀犯死刑这种涉及伦理道德的问题，有个观点并非难事。

sentences.english: If we accept that certain babies should be allowed to die, we place doctors in a moral dilemma .
sentences.chinese: 如果我们同意应该允许某些婴儿死去，那就是让医生在道德上处于两难境地了。

sentences.english: Man is gifted with a moral sense by which he distinguishes good from evil.
sentences.chinese: 人类天生有道德意识，能区分善与恶。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the principles of what is right and wrong behaviour, and with the difference between good and evil

detailed_translations.chinese: 品行， 道德规范； 寓意
detailed_translations.english: principles or standards of good behaviour, especially in matters of sex

name: mortality
trans: n. 必死性; 大量死亡; 死亡率

sentences.english: Mortality from heart disease varies widely across the world.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病死亡率世界各地差异很大。

detailed_translations.english: the number of deaths during a particular period of time among a particular type or group of people

name: motivation
trans: n. 动力；动机；诱因; adj. 动机的，动力的 形容词: motivational

name: mould
trans: n. 模具，铸模；个性，类型；霉，霉菌；耕作土壤，腐殖土 v. 浇铸，塑造；对……施加影响；将…塑造成；紧贴于，吻合；使长霉

sentences.english: Clothes mould in wet weather.
sentences.chinese: 天气潮湿时衣服会发霉。

sentences.english: Such oil can contain carcinogens and toxic mould.
sentences.chinese: 这种油可能包含致癌物和有毒的霉。

detailed_translations.english: to become or cause to become covered with this growth
a hollow container that you pour a liquid or soft substance into, so that when it becomes solid, it takes the shape of the container

name: mystery
trans: n. 神秘, 秘密; 神秘的事, 难以理解的事物; 来历不明的人

sentences.english: Twenty years after the event, his death remains a mystery .
sentences.chinese: 事情过去二十年了，他的死仍然是个谜。

sentences.english: The way her mind worked was always a mystery to him.
sentences.chinese: 她脑子里在想些什么对他来说始终是个谜。

sentences.english: ‘Why did he do it?’ ‘I don’t know. It’s a complete mystery .’
sentences.chinese: “他为什么这么做？” “我不知道，这完全是个谜。”

sentences.english: The police never solved the mystery of Gray’s disappearance.
sentences.chinese: 警察一直没有侦破格雷失踪的谜案。

sentences.english: But why would anyone want to kill Jack? The mystery deepened .
sentences.chinese: 但为什么会有人想杀死杰克呢？疑团越来越深了。

sentences.english: What happened to the paintings after that is an unsolved mystery .
sentences.chinese: 后来那些画的命运如何是个不解之谜。

sentences.english: I don’t know how he got the job – it’s one of life’s little mysteries .
sentences.chinese: 我不知道他是怎么得到那份工作的——那永远是个小小的谜。

sentences.english: How life began on Earth is one of the great mysteries of science.
sentences.chinese: 地球生命的起源是一大科学谜团。

detailed_translations.english: an event, situation etc that people do not understand or cannot explain because they do not know enough about it

name: myth
trans: n. 神话；虚构的人，虚构的事

sentences.english: a book of Greek myths
sentences.chinese: 一本关于希腊神话的图书

sentences.english: the giants of myth and fairytale
sentences.chinese: 神话和童话里的巨人

detailed_translations.english: an ancient story, especially one invented in order to explain natural or historical events

name: neuron
trans: n. 神经元，神经单位 形容词: neuronal

sentences.english: A neuron has only one axon.
sentences.chinese: 一个神经元只有一个轴突。

sentences.english: Between any neurons, between the axon of one neuron and the dendrite of another, there's a tiny gap.
sentences.chinese: 在神经元之间，在一个神经元的轴突，和另一个神经元的树突之间，有一个细小的缝隙。

sentences.english: But they don't know exactly what goes into that neuron to store the memory, or how to dissolve that synaptic connection if you want to forget something.
sentences.chinese: 但是他们不十分准确的了解存储记忆的时候是什么被带进了神经元，如果你想要忘记某些事情，有如何让连接的触突解散。

detailed_translations.english: a type of cell that makes up the nervous system and sends messages to other parts of the body or the brain

name: notion
trans: n. 概念；见解；打算

sentences.english: She had no notion what he meant.
sentences.chinese: 她根本不明白他是什么意思。

sentences.english: misguided notions of male superiority
sentences.chinese: 男尊女卑的错误观念

detailed_translations.english: an idea, belief, or opinion

name: nurture
trans: vt. 养育；培育，培养; n. 教养，培育 时 态: nurtured，nurturing，nurtures 名 词: nurturer

sentences.english: plants nurtured in the greenhouse
sentences.chinese: 在温室里培育的植物

detailed_translations.english: to feed and take care of a child or a plant while it is growing
the education and care that you are given as a child, and the way it affects your later development and attitudes

name: nutrient
trans: n. 营养物, 营养品; adj. 营养物的, 营养品的

sentences.english: The plant absorbs nutrients from the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物从土壤中吸取养分。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical or food that provides what is needed for plants or animals to live and grow

name: observer
trans: n. 观察者，观察员；遵守者

sentences.english: political observers
sentences.chinese: 政治观察员

sentences.english: Observers are predicting a fall in interest rates.
sentences.chinese: 观察员预测利率会下降。

detailed_translations.english: someone who regularly watches or pays attention to particular things, events, situations etc

name: obstacle
trans: n. 障碍, 妨碍

sentences.english: The tax puts obstacles in the way of companies trying to develop trade overseas.
sentences.chinese: 这项税收为想在海外发展贸易的公司设置了障碍。

sentences.english: Women still have to overcome many obstacles to gain equality.
sentences.chinese: 妇女要获得平等仍需克服重重障碍。

sentences.english: We want to remove all obstacles to travel between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们想要消除在这两个国家之间旅行的所有障碍。

sentences.english: the single biggest obstacle to a Conservative victory in the next election
sentences.chinese: 保守党在下一届大选中获胜的最大障碍

sentences.english: There are formidable obstacles on the road to peace.
sentences.chinese: 通往和平的道路上存在难以逾越的障碍。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes it difficult to achieve some­thing

name: optimism

sentences.chinese: 他们的皮肤饱经风霜被晒得黧黑，好像他们在臭氧中变成化石并在海湾边防止死亡。

sentences.english: The synergistic effect of oxygen and (or ) ozone in atmosphere with ultraviolet also led to the adhesion failure of adhesive.

sentences.english: There’s a package here for a Miami Lakes address.
sentences.chinese: 这里有一个寄往迈阿密湖的包裹。

to put food or other goods into a bag, box etc ready to be sold or sent

trans: n. 仪表板；嵌板；座谈小组，全体陪审员; vt. 嵌镶板 时 态: paneled , panelled paneling , panelling panels , panels

sentences.english: A panel of experts has looked at the proposal.
sentences.chinese: 一组专家审核了那项提议。

sentences.english: There will be at least three senior doctors on the panel.

trans: n. 步行者名 词: pedestrianism

sentences.chinese: 所有受伤的行人中有1/3以上是儿童。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is walking, especially along a street or other place used by cars

sentences.chinese: 没有许可他们不得离开这个国家。

trans: n. 人员; 员工; 人事部门

sentences.chinese: 用于防治虫害的一种化学品

trans: adj. 制药的;配药的

sentences.chinese: 制药业

sentences.chinese: 药物

Pharmaceuticals are medicines

sentences.chinese: 该经济体的生产能力

name: property

sentences.chinese: 宾馆对住客个人财物的丢失和损坏概不负责。

sentences.chinese: 在梅森家里找到了部分被盗财物。

sentences.chinese: 那个地区的很大一部分海豚最终都会死去。

sentences.chinese: 总统将提出解决国家宪法危机的新议案。

sentences.english: She politely declined his proposal of marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她礼貌地拒绝了他的求婚。

sentences.chinese: 想到要结婚，艾丽斯害怕极了。

trans: adj. 心理的; 精神的; 心理学的; 关于心理学的 副 词: psychologically

sentences.english: Sleep disorders are a serious psychological problem .
sentences.chinese: 睡眠障碍是严重的心理疾病。

sentences.english: Freud’s psychological theories
sentences.chinese: 弗洛伊德的心理学理论

sentences.english: What was the patient’s psychological state ?
sentences.chinese: 病人的心理状态如何？

sentences.english: water/air/beer etc pump (=for moving water, air etc)
sentences.chinese: 抽水机/抽气机/啤酒泵等

sentences.chinese: 仅用水泵将未经处理的污水排入海中是不够的。

sentences.chinese: 筹到的钱款将用来挖井眼，再将水抽入干涸的湖中。

sentences.chinese: 她付钱买好东西离开了。

sentences.chinese: 我附上小票作为购物凭证。

sentences.english: She made two purchases from my stall.
sentences.chinese: 她从我的货摊上买了两样东西。

sentences.chinese: 你可以在网上买保险。

sentences.chinese: 她计划从政。

sentences.english: Students should pursue their own interests , as well as do their school work.

name: qualify
trans: vt. & vi. 具有资格, 合格; vt. 限定, 修饰 时 态: qualified, qualifying, qualifies

sentences.english: Free school lunches are given to children who qualify.
sentences.chinese: 符合条件的儿童可获得免费的学生午餐。

detailed_translations.english: to have the right to have or do something, or to give someone this right

name: quantity
trans: n. 量，数量；总量；大量

sentences.english: Your work has improved in quantity and quality this term.
sentences.chinese: 这学期你的作业在完成数量和质量上都有提高。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of something that can be counted or measured

name: questionnaire
trans: n. 调查表,问卷

sentences.english: Teachers will be asked to fill in a questionnaire.
sentences.chinese: 教师们将被要求填写一份调查问卷。

detailed_translations.english: a written set of questions which you give to a large number of people in order to collect information

name: radical
trans: adj. 根本的，基本的；彻底的，完全的; 激进的，激进派的 副 词: radically 名 词: radicalness

sentences.english: They are proposing radical changes to the way the company is run.
sentences.chinese: 他们建议对公司经营模式进行重大改革。

sentences.english: a radical reform of the tax system
sentences.chinese: 税收制度的彻底改革

sentences.english: There are radical differences between the two organizations.
sentences.chinese: 这两个组织有着根本差异。

detailed_translations.chinese: 根本的，基本的；激进的，激进派的
detailed_translations.english: a radical change or difference is very big and important
someone who has new and different ideas, especially someone who wants complete social and political change

name: random
trans: adj. 任意的；胡乱的；随机的; n. 随意; adv. 胡乱地 副 词: randomly 名 词: randomness

sentences.english: The gang picked their victims at random.
sentences.chinese: 这帮犯罪分子随意选择对象下手。

sentences.english: The company has introduced random drug testing of its employees.
sentences.chinese: 公司已实行对雇员的随机毒品测试。

detailed_translations.english: without any definite plan, aim, or pattern
happening or chosen without any definite plan, aim, or pattern

name: reckon
trans: vt. 猜想；估计; 〈非正〉思忖；设想; 考虑；认为; 〈正〉计算 时 态: reckoned，reckoning，reckons

sentences.english: ‘There’s nothing we can do about it.’ ‘You reckon (= used to express doubt or disagreement ) ?’
sentences.chinese: “这件事我们无能为力。”“是吗？”

detailed_translations.english: spoken to think or suppose something

name: recommend
trans: vt. 推荐, 介绍, 赞许某人; 劝告, 建议; 使…显得可取 时 态: recommended, recommending, recommends 形容词: recomm...

sentences.english: I recommend the butter chicken - it’s delicious.
sentences.chinese: 我推荐黄油焗鸡，非常好吃。

sentences.english: Can you recommend a good lawyer?
sentences.chinese: 你能介绍一位好律师吗？

detailed_translations.english: to say that something or someone is good, or suggest them for a particular purpose or job

name: recreational
trans: adj. 休养的,娱乐的

sentences.english: ...parks and other recreational facilities.
sentences.chinese: …公园及其它娱乐设施。

detailed_translations.english: Recreational means relating to things people do in their spare time to relax

name: register
trans: vt. 记录；注册；登记；把…挂号；挂号邮寄；正式提出; vi. 登记；注册；挂号; n. 注册；登记簿；登记；记录；寄存器 时 态: registered, registerin...

sentences.english: Have you signed the hotel register ?
sentences.chinese: 你在酒店登记簿上签名了吗？

sentences.english: Police want a national register of DNA samples.
sentences.chinese: 警方想要一个全国范围的DNA样本登记册。

sentences.english: How many students have registered for English classes?
sentences.chinese: 有多少学生注册选修英语课了？

detailed_translations.english: an official list of names of people, companies etc, or a book that has this list
to put someone’s or something’s name on an official list

name: regulate
trans: vt. 调节，规定；有系统的管理；控制；校准 时 态: regulated, regulating, regulates

sentences.english: People sweat to regulate their body heat.
sentences.chinese: 人出汗以调节体温。

detailed_translations.english: to make a machine or your body work at a particular speed, temperature etc

name: reinforce
trans: v. 加强；充实；使更强烈; 加固；使更结实; 为 增加力量；向增兵；增援; 给予…更多支持；为…提供更多证据 时 态: reinforced, reinforcing, rei...

sentences.english: I hope this will reinforce Indonesian determination to deal with this kind of threat.
sentences.chinese: 我希望这会加强印度尼西亚对付这类威胁的决心。

sentences.english: Both sides have been reinforcing their positions after yesterday's fierce fighting.
sentences.chinese: 在昨天的激战后，双方一直在增援各自的阵地。

detailed_translations.english: to give support to an opinion, idea, or feeling, and make it stronger

name: remedy
trans: n. 药品, 治疗法; 补救办法, 纠正办法

sentences.english: The problems in our schools do not have a simple remedy.
sentences.chinese: 我们学校的问题没有简单的解决办法。

sentences.english: To remedy the situation, the water must be chemically treated.
sentences.chinese: 为了改善这种情况，水必须进行化学处理。

detailed_translations.english: a way of dealing with a problem or making a bad situation better
to deal with a problem or improve a bad situation

name: remote
trans: adj. 遥远的；远的; 远离的，遥远的；偏僻的; 冷淡的，疏远的，漠不关心的; 微小的；轻微的 比较级: remoter，remotest 副 词: remotely ...

sentences.english: a remote border town
sentences.chinese: 一个偏远的边境小镇

sentences.english: a fire in a remote mountain area
sentences.chinese: 偏远山区的火灾

detailed_translations.chinese: 遥远的， 偏僻的； 关系疏远的； 脱离的； 绝少的； 微乎其微的； 孤高的， 冷淡的
detailed_translations.english: far from towns or other places where people live

name: removal
trans: n. 移动；免职；排除；搬迁

sentences.english: the removal of rubbish
sentences.chinese: 移除垃圾

sentences.english: stain removal
sentences.chinese: 去污

detailed_translations.english: when something is taken away from, out of, or off the place where it is

name: renaissance
trans: n. 文艺复兴, 文艺复兴时期

sentences.english: ...the Renaissance masterpieces in London's galleries.
sentences.chinese: …伦敦美术馆里文艺复兴时期的杰作。

detailed_translations.english: a new interest in something, especially a particular form of art, music etc, that has not been popular for a long period

name: renowned
trans: adj. 有名的;享有声誉的

sentences.english: The area is renowned for its Romanesque churches.
sentences.chinese: 这个地区以其罗马式教堂闻名。

detailed_translations.english: known and admired by a lot of people, especially for a special skill, achievement, or quality

name: rental
trans: n. 租赁；租金收入，租金; adj. 租赁的；收取租金的

sentences.english: Video rental is usually £3.
sentences.chinese: 录像带的租金通常是3英镑。

detailed_translations.english: the money that you pay to use a car, television, or other machine over a period of time

name: repeat
trans: vt. & vi. 重说，重做; vt. 复述，背诵; 再次供应; vi. 吃后仍留有余味; n. 重复；复述；背诵; 重演，重播 时 态: repeated，repeating，re...

sentences.english: Can you repeat your question?
sentences.chinese: 你能重复一遍你的问题吗？

sentences.english: Sorry - could you repeat that?
sentences.chinese: 对不起——你能再说一遍吗？

sentences.english: It is not, I repeat not, my fault.
sentences.chinese: 那不是我的错，我再说一遍，不是。

sentences.english: It was a terrible journey - I hope we don’t have a repeat performance (= have the same thing happen again ) on the way home.
sentences.chinese: 这一路上太糟糕了——我希望回程可不要再发生同样的事。

detailed_translations.english: to say or write something again
an event that is very like something that happened before

name: replace
trans: vt. 取代，代替；替换，更换；归还，偿还；把…放回原处 时 态: replaced, replacing, replaces 缩 写: repl 形容词: replac...

sentences.english: I’m replacing Sue on the team.
sentences.chinese: 我将接替队里的休。

sentences.english: Lectures have replaced the old tutorial system.
sentences.chinese: 课堂授课取代了旧式的导师制。

detailed_translations.english: to start doing something instead of another person, or start being used instead of another thing

name: replicate
trans: vt. 复制；重复时 态: replicated，replicating，replicates 形容词: replicative

sentences.english: There is a need for further research to replicate these findings.
sentences.chinese: 需要进一步的研究来验证这些结果。

detailed_translations.english: if you replicate someone’s work, a scientific study etc, you do it again, or try to get the same result again

detailed_translations.chinese: 复制品；八音阶间隔的反覆音

name: represent
trans: vt. 表现, 描绘; 代表, 象征, 表示; 作为…的代表 时 态: represented, representing, represents 名 词: represen...

sentences.english: Mr Kobayashi was chosen to represent the company at the conference.
sentences.chinese: 小林先生被选中代表公司出席会议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 作为…的代表， 表示， 象征； 描绘， 表现
detailed_translations.english: to officially speak or take action for another person or group of people

name: resemble
trans: vt. 像…, 类似于时 态: resembled, resembling, resembles

sentences.english: It’s amazing how closely Brian and Steve resemble each other.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩和史蒂夫真是惊人地相像。

sentences.english: He grew up to resemble his father.
sentences.chinese: 他长大了，很像他父亲。

detailed_translations.english: to look like or be similar to someone or something

name: reserve
trans: vt. 保留某物; 具有或保持; 预订或保留；订购; n. 贮藏；储备; 保护区; 矜持，拘谨；寡言 时 态: reserved，reserving，reserves

sentences.english: Do you have to reserve tickets in advance?
sentences.chinese: 你必须预先订票吗？

detailed_translations.english: to arrange for a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc to be kept for you to use at a particular time in the future

detailed_translations.chinese: 储备； 保留； 拘谨， 矜持； 替补队员， 后备部队； 自然保护区
detailed_translations.english: a supply of something kept to be used if it is needed

name: residence
trans: n. 住处; 住宅; 公馆; 居住; 居留期间

sentences.english: Rome was his main place of residence.
sentences.chinese: 罗马是他的主要居住地。

sentences.english: the ambassador’s official residence
sentences.chinese: 大使官邸

detailed_translations.english: the state of living in a place

name: resolve
trans: vt. 决定；使…分解；决心要做…；溶解; vi. 决心；解决；分解; n. 坚决；决定要做的事 时 态: resolved, resolving, resolves 形容词...

sentences.english: Barnet was desperate for money to resolve his financial problems.
sentences.chinese: 巴尼特急需钱来解决他的经济问题。

sentences.english: After the divorce she resolved never to marry again.
sentences.chinese: 离婚以后，她决心永不再嫁。

sentences.english: Recent events strengthened her resolve to find out the truth.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件坚定了她找出真相的决心。

detailed_translations.english: to find a satisfactory way of dealing with a problem or difficulty
strong determination to succeed in doing something

name: restore
trans: vt. 修复；恢复；归还; vi. 还原；恢复 时 态: restored, restoring, restores 名 词: restorer

sentences.english: She was hoping that the Mediterranean climate would restore her to full health.
sentences.chinese: 她希望地中海的气候能使她的身体完全复原。

sentences.english: The National Guard was called in to restore order (= make people stop fighting and breaking the law ) when riots broke out.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱爆发后，国民警卫队被调来恢复秩序。

sentences.english: initiatives to restore peace in the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 恢复中东和平的倡议

sentences.english: a Victorian fireplace restored to its former glory
sentences.chinese: 恢复了昔日华美的维多利亚时代的壁炉

sentences.english: The treaty restored Okinawa to Japan.
sentences.chinese: 该条约将冲绳归还给了日本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something return to its former state or condition

name: restrict
trans: vt. 限制；限定；约束 时 态: restricted, restricting, restricts

sentences.english: The new law restricts the sale of hand guns.
sentences.chinese: 新法规限制手枪的销售。

sentences.english: You may need to restrict access to certain files (= limit the number of people who can read them ) .
sentences.chinese: 某些档案可能需要限制查阅。

sentences.english: The agreement will restrict competition.
sentences.chinese: 这个协议将限制竞争。

sentences.english: The cramped living conditions severely restricted the children’s freedom to play.
sentences.chinese: 拥挤的居住条件严重限制了孩子们玩耍的自由。

detailed_translations.english: to limit or control the size, amount, or range of something

name: reveal
trans: vt. 显示；露出; 泄露；透露 时 态: revealed，revealing，reveals 形容词: revealable 名 词: revealer 名 ...

sentences.english: He may be prosecuted for revealing secrets about the security agency.
sentences.chinese: 他可能因泄露安全部门的机密而被起诉。

sentences.english: a test that can reveal a teacher’s hidden skills
sentences.chinese: 能够展现老师潜在技能的测试

detailed_translations.english: to make known something that was previously secret or unknown

name: reverse
trans: vt. & vi. 反转；颠倒；翻转; 推翻，取消; 使倒退，逆转; adj. 相反的，颠倒的，反向的; n. 相反; 钱币的反面; 失败，挫败 时 态: reversed，rever...

sentences.english: Reverse the paper in the printer.
sentences.chinese: 把打印机中的纸翻过来。

sentences.english: The wrong attitude will have exactly the reverse effect.
sentences.chinese: 这种错误的态度会得到恰好相反的结果。

detailed_translations.english: if a vehicle or its driver reverses, they go backwards

detailed_translations.chinese: 反向的； 相反的； 颠倒的
detailed_translations.english: Reverse means opposite from what you expect or to what has just been described

detailed_translations.chinese: 撤销，废除；使完全相反，彻底转变；使反转，使次序颠倒
detailed_translations.english: to change something, such as a decision, judgment, or process so that it is the opposite of what it was before

detailed_translations.chinese: 相反情况，对立面；反面，背面，后面；损失，倒退
detailed_translations.english: the exact opposite of what has just been mentioned

name: revised
trans: 改进的

name: rival
trans: n. 竞争对手; vt. 与…竞争, 与…匹敌 时 态: rivaled , rivalled rivaling , rivalling rivals , rivals

sentences.english: This gives the company a competitive advantage over its rivals.
sentences.chinese: 这使该公司与其对手相比具有一项竞争优势。

sentences.english: He finished 39 seconds ahead of his main rival .
sentences.chinese: 他比主要对手早39秒到达终点。

sentences.english: She was 2 minutes faster than her nearest rival .
sentences.chinese: 她比紧随其后的对手快两分钟。

sentences.english: a game against their old rivals , Manchester United
sentences.chinese: 和他们的老对手曼联队的比赛

sentences.english: They still remain bitter rivals (= hate each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们仍是死敌。

sentences.english: Their sales have now overtaken those of their arch-rival (= main or strongest rival ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的销售额现已超过了主要竞争对手。

detailed_translations.english: a person, group, or organization that you compete with in sport, business, a fight etc

name: rotate
trans: vi. 旋转；循环; vt. 使旋转；使转动；使轮流; adj. 辐状的 时 态: rotated, rotating, rotates 形容词: rotatable

sentences.english: The Earth rotates on its axis once every 24 hours.
sentences.chinese: 地球每24小时绕地轴自转一周。

sentences.english: Rotate the pan halfway through the baking time.
sentences.chinese: 烘烤到一半时把盘子转一下。

detailed_translations.english: to turn with a circular movement around a central point, or to make something do this
to turn with a circular movement around a central point, or to make something do this

name: route
trans: n. 路, 路途, 路线, 路程时 态: routed, routing, routes

sentences.english: Trains are taking a lot of freight that used to be routed via trucks.
sentences.chinese: 火车正在运送过去由卡车运送的大批货物。

detailed_translations.english: to send something somewhere using a particular route
a way from one place to another

name: royal
trans: adj. 国王的，女王的; 大规模的；极大的 副 词: royally

sentences.english: the royal palace
sentences.chinese: 王宫

sentences.english: the royal family
sentences.chinese: 王室

detailed_translations.english: relating to or belonging to a king or queen

name: salary
trans: n. 薪水形容词: salaried

sentences.english: The average salary for a teacher is $39,000 a year.
sentences.chinese: 教师的平均工资是39,000美元一年。

detailed_translations.english: money that you receive as payment from the organization you work for, usually paid to you every month

name: schedule
trans: vt. 排定, 安排; n. 时间表, 日程安排表; 清单, 明细表 时 态: scheduled, scheduling, schedules 形容词: schedular...

sentences.english: How can he fit everything into his busy schedule ?
sentences.chinese: 他是怎么把所有的事情都排进自己忙碌的时间表的？

sentences.english: I’m going to be working to a very tight schedule (= including a lot of things that must be done in a short time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的工作安排将会非常紧。

detailed_translations.english: a plan of what someone is going to do and when they are going to do it

name: scheme
trans: vt. & vi. 策划；图谋; n. 阴谋，诡计; 计划，方案 时 态: schemed，scheming，schemes 名 词: schemer

sentences.english: The money will be used for teacher training schemes.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱将用于教师培训计划。

sentences.english: a pension scheme
sentences.chinese: 退休金计划

sentences.english: a get-rich-quick scheme
sentences.chinese: 快速致富的手段

detailed_translations.english: an official plan that is intended to help people in some way, for example by providing education or training

name: scout
trans: n. 侦察员；侦察机；侦察兵; 人才发掘者，星探; 童子军队员；童子军; v. 侦察；搜索；寻找; 物色 Scout侦察兵火箭时 态: scouted, scouting, s...

sentences.english: He sent three scouts ahead to take a look at the bridge.
sentences.chinese: 他派出三名侦察兵到前面侦察大桥的情况。

detailed_translations.chinese: 搜索，侦察；侦察员；侦察机
detailed_translations.english: a soldier, plane etc that is sent to search the area in front of an army and get information about the enemy
to examine a place or area in order to get information about it

name: screen
trans: n. 屏幕，荧光屏，荧屏; 银幕; 电影，电视; 隔板，屏风，幕，帘，帐; 掩蔽物，掩护物，屏障，庇护; 纱窗，纱门; 围屏; v. 掩藏，遮蔽，保护; 庇护，包庇，袒护; 筛查，检查; ...

sentences.english: a computer with an 18-inch colour screen
sentences.chinese: 带18英寸彩色屏幕的电脑

sentences.english: He went on staring at the TV screen .
sentences.chinese: 他继续盯着电视屏幕看。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a television or computer where the picture or information appears

detailed_translations.chinese: 掩蔽， 遮蔽； 放映， 播放； 审查， 甄别
detailed_translations.english: if something screens something else, it is in front of it and hides it

name: sculpture
trans: n. 雕刻, 雕塑; 雕刻品; vt. & vi. 雕刻, 雕塑 时 态: sculptured, sculpturing, sculptures 形容词: sculptur...

sentences.english: a sculpture of an elephant
sentences.chinese: 一尊大象雕塑

sentences.english: the techniques of sculpture in stone
sentences.chinese: 石雕技艺

detailed_translations.english: an object made out of stone, wood, clay etc by an artist

name: seal
trans: n. 海豹; 印章, 印鉴, 图章; 封条, 封蜡; vt. 盖章于; 密封; 决定 SEALabbr. Sea,Air,and Land 海,空,陆 SEALabbr. Sea, ...

sentences.english: The document carried the seal of the governor’s office.
sentences.chinese: 文件上盖有州长办公室的章。

sentences.english: He broke the wax seal and unrolled the paper.
sentences.chinese: 他揭去封蜡，把纸卷展开。

sentences.english: The window was sealed shut.
sentences.chinese: 这扇窗户被封了起来。

detailed_translations.english: a mark that has a special design and shows the legal or official authority of a person or organization
to close an entrance or a container with something that stops air, water etc from coming in or out of it

name: seasonal
trans: adj. 季节的,季节性的,随季节变化的名 词: seasonality

sentences.english: heavy seasonal rains
sentences.chinese: 季节性的大雨

detailed_translations.english: if a process accelerates or if something accelerates it, it happens faster than usual or sooner than you expect

name: accessible
trans: adj. 容易取得的，容易获得的，容易达到的; 可接近的，可进入的；易接近的，易进入的; 易见到的，易相处的，平易近人的，可与之打交道的; 可理解的，易懂的; 易受影响的，易感染的，易受引诱...

sentences.english: The island is only accessible by boat.
sentences.chinese: 这个岛只有坐船才能到。

sentences.english: There is a church which is easily accessible from my home.
sentences.chinese: 有座教堂离我家很近。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易接近的；可进入的；可理解的
detailed_translations.english: a place, building, or object that is accessible is easy to reach or get into

name: accompany
trans: vt. 陪伴, 陪同; 伴随…同时发生; 伴奏 时 态: accompanied, accompanying, accompanies

sentences.english: Children under 14 must be accompanied by an adult.
sentences.chinese: 14岁以下儿童必须有成人陪同。

sentences.english: Wherever her husband went, she would accompany him.
sentences.chinese: 不论丈夫去哪里，她都陪伴左右。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陪同， 伴随； 为…伴奏
detailed_translations.english: to go somewhere with someone

name: accomplish
trans: vt. 完成, 实现, 做成功时 态: accomplished, accomplishing, accomplishes 形容词: accomplishable 名 词:...

sentences.english: We have accomplished all we set out to do.
sentences.chinese: 所有计划要做的事情，我们都已完成。

sentences.english: Mission accomplished(=  we have done what we intended to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 大功告成。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in doing something, especially after trying very hard

name: account
trans: n. 账户; 账，账目; 账户，账号; 赊销账；赊欠账；赊购; 固定客户，老主顾; 记述，描述，陈述，报告; 解释，说明，叙述; v. 认为是；视为 时 态: accounted，ac...

sentences.english: My salary is paid into my bank account.
sentences.chinese: 我的工资直接存入我的银行账户。

sentences.english: I’ve opened an account with Barclay’s Bank.
sentences.chinese: 我在巴克莱银行开了一个账户。

sentences.english: My husband and I have a joint account (=  one that is shared between two people  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我和丈夫有个联名账户。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement in which a bank keeps your money safe so that you can pay more in or take money out

name: accurate
trans: adj. 精确的, 准确的，正确无误的 副 词: accurately 名 词: accuracy

sentences.english: The brochure tries to give a fair and accurate description of each hotel.
sentences.chinese: 该手册尽量公正、准确地介绍每一家酒店。

detailed_translations.english: correct and true in every detail

name: acknowledge
trans: vt. 承认, 供认; 告知已收到; 鸣谢, 感谢 时 态: acknowledged, acknowledging, acknowledges 缩 写: ack

sentences.english: The family acknowledge the need for change.
sentences.chinese: 全家人都承认需要改变一下。

sentences.english: I would be grateful if you would acknowledge receipt of this letter.
sentences.chinese: 收到此信后请告知，不胜感谢。

detailed_translations.english: to admit or accept that something is true or that a situation exists

name: acoustic
trans: adj. 声音的, 听觉的副 词: acoustically

sentences.english: In our case, we have found the true acoustic echo beacon.
sentences.chinese: 但在这种情况下，我们发现了真正的声学‘回声灯塔’ ”。

sentences.english: This gives it excellent thermal and acoustic properties, but the suitability of the product for a large-scale commercial project was questioned.
sentences.chinese: 这给了它出色的热学和声学属性，但是这种产品是否适合于一个大尺度的商业项目还是个问题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有关声音的, 声学的
detailed_translations.english: relating to sound and the way people hear things

name: acquisition
trans: n. 获得物，获得；收购

sentences.english: the acquisition of language
sentences.chinese: 语言的习得

detailed_translations.english: the process by which you gain knowledge or learn a skill
